summary: Directed evolution and rational protein design are key methods for creating improved biocatalysts, with directed evolution involving random mutagenesis or recombination followed by high-throughput screening to identify variants with desired properties.
key_claims: Directed evolution involves random mutagenesis of enzyme genes using techniques like error-prone PCR and recombination, followed by screening to find improved variants.
Rational protein design requires the availability of enzyme structure and knowledge about sequence-structure-function relationships.
